Isabella Rodriguez.description: preparing for her birthday party at Hobbs Cafe at 5:00 pm (going to the store to purchase supplies) @ the Ville:Harvey Oak Supply Store:supply store:supply store counter

Carlos Gomez.description: taking a break and going for a walk in nature (walking back home) @ the Ville:Johnson Park:park:park garden

Klaus Mueller.description: still working on his research paper at the library (conversing about how Klaus Mueller and Eddy Lin plan to incorporate elements of jazz music and African American literature into their poetry reading event to uplift diverse voices, promote inclusivity, engage with marginalized communities, prioritize accessibility, and showcase a variety of talent from different cultural backgrounds, including Black LGBTQ+ individuals, while collaborating with local organizations and businesses to amplify underrepresented voices.) @ the Ville:artist's co-living space:common room:common room sofa

Sam Moore.description: preparing for his birthday party at The Rose and Crown Pub (preparing the food and drinks for the party) @ the Ville:Harvey Oak Supply Store:supply store:supply store counter

Ayesha Khan.description: conversing about Ayesha Khan and Wolfgang Schulz are discussing the inclusion of workshops, spoken word performances, collaborations with Black-owned businesses and LGBTQ+ organizations, and the importance of diversity and inclusivity at their poetry reading event. @ <persona> Wolfgang Schulz
chat: Ayesha Khan
Hey Wolfgang, I was thinking about incorporating a segment on the historical impact of systemic racism at our poetry reading event. What do you think?
Wolfgang Schulz

That's a great idea, Ayesha. I believe highlighting the historical impact of systemic racism will add an important layer of depth to our event. We could also consider inviting local activists and historians to share their insights.
Ayesha Khan
I agree, it's crucial to provide a platform for these voices to be heard and understood. We should also ensure that our event remains inclusive and welcoming to all attendees.
Wolfgang Schulz
We could also explore the possibility of collaborating with Black-owned businesses and artists to further amplify the voices of underrepresented communities.
Ayesha Khan
I think it would also be impactful to include workshops on allyship and privilege to educate our audience on these important topics.
Wolfgang Schulz
It would be beneficial to center Black LGBTQ+ individuals in our event as well, ensuring that their voices are prominently featured.
Ayesha Khan
We should also consider hosting a workshop specifically addressing unconscious bias and microaggressions to create a safe and inclusive space for all attendees.
Wolfgang Schulz
Ayesha, I think it's also important for us to actively engage with the local Black LGBTQ+ community leaders and activists to ensure that our event is representative and supportive of their voices.
Ayesha Khan
I completely agree. We should aim to create a mentorship program for young Black leaders to ensure full representation and inclusivity at our event.
Wolfgang Schulz
We should also make sure to provide accessibility options for all attendees, including sign language interpretation and subtitles, to ensure that everyone can fully participate in our event.
Ayesha Khan
I think it's essential to involve young aspiring poets from diverse backgrounds to share their work at the event.
Wolfgang Schulz
Ayesha, I believe it would be impactful to collaborate with LGBTQ+ organizations to further promote diversity and inclusivity at our event. What are your thoughts on that?
Ayesha Khan
I think collaborating with LGBTQ+ organizations would be a fantastic idea. It will definitely help us create a more diverse and inclusive event.
Wolfgang Schulz
Ayesha, I was also considering incorporating spoken word performances that address unconscious bias and microaggressions. What do you think about that?
Ayesha Khan
I think featuring spoken word performances on unconscious bias and microaggressions would be a powerful way to raise awareness and promote reflection among our audience.
Wolfgang Schulz
Ayesha, I also think it would be beneficial to showcase a mix of established and emerging artists at our event to provide a platform for diverse voices to be heard.
